raw_comment: I noticed that it is more likely for the students whose parents earn a higher income to get accepted into elite colleges. I wonder why the wealthier families have the advantage of getting accepted compared to the lower class families. This doesn't really relate to me because I am not trying to get into an elite college or Ivy League at the moment. This might relate to my community because most of the students and their families are wealthy and I see that most of the hard-working students end up getting into good colleges. A catchy headline that captures the graph's main idea is "Acceptance into College: Higher Legacy vs Higher Capability"
ace_sentences: Students whose parents earn a higher income are more likely to get accepted into elite colleges.
I wonder why wealthier families have an advantage in getting accepted into elite colleges.
Lower-class families have less advantage in getting accepted into elite colleges.
This situation does not relate to me at the moment.
I am not trying to get into an elite college at the moment.
I am not trying to get into an Ivy League college at the moment.
This situation might relate to my community.
Most students in my community are wealthy.
Most families in my community are wealthy.
I see that most hard-working students in my community get accepted into good colleges.
The headline is: Acceptance into College: Higher Legacy vs Higher Capability.
